communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Lasher emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Emails between Micah Lasher and email addresses containing the following domain names:

rebny.com
related.com
vno.com
hess.com
meqs.com
coinmint.one
rxr.com 
tishmanspeyer.com
nirvana.money
websterbank.com
douglasdev.com
granitenet.com
unfinished.com
mccourt.com
rich.com
somersetpartnersllc.com
gtlaw.com

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sam Mellins

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Groups.io (Newport Beach Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am looking for emails and messages posted and received from a “group.io” community. As such please search department records for:

- Any emails where the sender has a @groups.io email address
- emails containing the words “kloving” or “group notification”

Please include any record created after January 1 2020 until todays date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

The Newport Beach Police Department received your California Public Records Act request on June 16, 2024. This response will serve as the Department’s notice of determination as to whether the request in or part seeks the production of non-exempt, non-privileged, disclosable public records in the possession of the City, pursuant to the California Public Records Act (“Act”) (Gov. Code §§ 7920.000 et seq.).

You requested “Any emails where the sender has a @groups.io email address” and “emails containing the words “kloving” or “group notification””

The responsive records are available on a USB drive, due to the file size I am unable to upload it onto this platform. Please provide a mailing address and I can mail the records directly to you. 

Some emails have not been provided in accordance with the following exemption:

Police/Investigative Records:  Records of complaints to, or investigations conducted by, or records of intelligence information or security procedures of…any state or local police agency, or any investigatory or security files compiled by any…local agency for correctional, law enforcement, or licensing purposes.  (Gov. Code § 7923.600(a))

Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: Groups.io (Newport Beach Police Department)
communications.communication: Thanks so much for this. You can send it to 155 spring valley st, Beacon NY 12508
Thank you, the records will be mailed out tomorrow.

communications.subject: Nebraska Public Records Act Request: Traffic Stop Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Nebraska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A tabular data file containing all information collected in accordance with Nebraska § 20-504 including but not limited to: date of stop, time of stop, race of driver, gender of driver, age of driver, if search occurred, if contraband was found, anonymized officer ID, and stop location for all years available.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Parry

communications.subject: Welcome to the Records Center!

Dear Emma Parry, 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Omaha, Nebraska. 
 
Your Login ID is:  162893-09117044@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://omahane.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP/_rs/ForgotPassword.aspx) 
 
Please login to "My Request Center" to update your account information, track the status of your request and receive requested records when they become available. This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Parry

communications.subject: [Records Center] Police Records Request :: P001541-042924
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
  
   
  City of Omaha 
 Jean Stothert, Mayor  Todd R. Schmaderer 
Chief of Police 
 
 Omaha Police Department 
 “To Serve and Protect” 
 505 South 15th Street 
 Omaha, Nebraska 68102-2769 
 (402) 444-5600 
 (402) 444-5898 
 police.cityofomaha.org (mailto:police.cityofomaha.org) Dear Emma, On behalf of Chief of Police Todd Schmaderer, I am responding to your request for Omaha Police Department records. Your request is made pursuant to the provisions of the Nebraska Public Records Act. In your request dated April 29, 2024 you sought information related to date of stop, time of stop, race of driver, gender of driver, age of driver, if search occurred, if contraband was found, anonymized officer ID, and stop location for all years available. This is the response required by NEB. REV. STAT. § 84-712, et seq. The Nebraska public records statute allows persons the right to examine public records in the possession of public agencies during normal agency business hours, to make memorandum and abstracts from those public records, and to obtain copies of public records in certain circumstances. The statute does not require a public agency to review documents and create abstracts or other lists, to answer questions, or to create documents that do not otherwise exist. See NEB.REV.STAT. § 84-712. Although the Nebraska public records statutes provided for access to public documents, such access is not absolute. The statutes also provide for exceptions to disclosures by express and special provisions; there are 21 categories of documents that may be kept confidential from the public at the discretion of the agency involved. See Neb. Rev. Stat. § 84-712.05. I have attached the available data we were able to pull from our database to the portal attachment tab for your refereence. There are random blanks for race, gender, and location in the data. All fields are supposed to be filled out, however, based on my experience with drop down boxes on our cruiser computers, the occassional clerical error can occur as the information doesn't always populate from the drop down menu. Please let me know if you have any questions regarding this. Section 84-712.03 of the Nebraska Revised Statutes may grant you the right to administrative or judicial review of this response. Please consult the statute for further information. Chief of Police Todd Schmaderer is responsible for denying a portion of your request. Thank you for your patience in my response to this request. If you have any questions about the legal basis for this response, please contact me at 402.444.5259.

files.source: Omaha Police Department, Omaha, NE

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: .gov registration information for welcometousa.gov
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Request forms, emails, logs, and other records created while processing requests to register, renew, update and/or withdraw the .gov registration for the domain name "welcometousa.gov",
2. including, for each such request, at least the following information where it exists:
- the date when the request was received by CISA
- name of the organization requesting the domain name
- name, role, and contact information of the person making the request
- name, role, and contact information of the authorizing official
- name, role, and contact information for administrative, management, or security contacts for this domain name
3. created between 2006 and 2018, inclusive.

I believe these records are maintained by CISA as part of its .gov program, as described on https://beta.get.gov/about/. Although the domain name in question is no longer active, I believe it was registered some time in 2006 or 2007, and withdrawn some time in 2018.

If any of the items listed under (2) above cannot be disclosed, I request that you redact them and release only the items that can be disclosed.

I request that you include all cross-referenced records relevant to my inquiry. If including emails, please include email attachments as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksejs Popovs

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking official documentation related to the employment history of the persons listed below:

Cerelyn	Davis
James M. Ryall
Michael	Rallings
Toney	Armstrong
Larry	Godwin
James	Bolen
Walter	Crews
Bill	Oldham
Walter	Winfrey
Melvin	Burgess
James	Ivy

Specifically, I request the formal offer letter or employment agreement issued upon their commencement of the position. I am also interested in official documents regarding their departure, such as a resignation letter or termination notice.

Please provide the relevant documents, which specify their start and end dates (both as MM/DD/YYYY), and any other pertinent details relating to the type of separation and if they were internal/external to the Department.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with John Navarro.

title: Santa Monica John Doe Suicide 1981 Autopsy Report

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Santa Monica John Doe Suicide 1981 Autopsy Report
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A complete copy of the Los Angeles County Coroner's report (1981-13382) for an unidentified male decedent who was discovered on October 20th of 1981. The NamUs case file number for this person is 4326. According to the NamUs listing, the decedent was witnessed jumping out of a window. In addition, a suicide note was found in his pocket. The DME presumably concluded their investigation long ago. 

Please search for a coroner's report(s) that could be labeled as "exam protocol", "medical report", "case report" or "investigator's narrative."

 I am hopeful that the release of information will assist in the identification of this person.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Madison Police Department, Madison, WI Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Chronic Nuisance Premises as described in 25.09 of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Re: Thank you for contacting City of Madison Police Records
communications.communication:
Your email request has been received and placed in our processing queue.  Due to the volume of requests, the estimated processing time is as follows:

.         Standard records request (reports/video/photos)- approximately 6-8 weeks

·         Contacts, calls for service or background checks- 2 weeks.


You will be contacted when your request has been completed.

If you are requesting a crash report, these are maintained at the Department of Transportation.  They can be contacted  directly at https://app.wi.gov/crashreports or by calling (608) 266-8753 (and selecting option 3).  For processing this request, you will need the DOT document number located in the upper right corner of the Driver Exchange of Information Form.  This document number will begin with 9B or 01L.  Crash reports are available from DOT approximately 2 weeks after the date of the crash.

If you need any further information, please visit our website at www.cityofmadison.com/police/services<http://www.cityofmadison.com/police/services> or call (608) 266-4075 between 8:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. Monday through Friday.  Thank you for contacting Madison Police Records.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: CPS Arrest Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Records that show all CPS incidents that included a student referral to law enforcement, including school-based resource officers, the underlying offense, the result of each referral, such as arrest or ticket/citation for municipal ordinance violation, and the gender, race, disability status and ELL status of the students who were referred for the 2021-2022, 2022-2023 and the 2023-2024 school years. Please also include the school in the data breakdown. The records could include, but not be limited to, disciplinary logs or reports, incident logs or reports, behavior resolution reports, and data that reflects the referrals, arrests and citations during the above years.

2. The number of arrests of students on CPS property from July 1, 2021 to current broken down by CPS property name and address. Please break this data down by age of arrestee.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center.

communications.subject: Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N015401-061124
Non-Commercial FOIA Request :: N015401-061124
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
June 25, 2024 Miriam Bhimani 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015401-061124 
Dear Miriam Bhimani: 
This letter is in reply to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking the following information: 
1. Records that show all CPS incidents that included a student referral to law enforcement, including school-based resource officers, the underlying offense, the result of each referral, such as arrest or ticket/citation for municipal ordinance violation, and the gender, race, disability status and ELL status of the students who were referred for the 2021-2022, 2022-2023 and the 2023-2024 school years. Please also include the school in the data breakdown. The records could include, but not be limited to, disciplinary logs or reports, incident logs or reports, behavior resolution reports, and data that reflects the referrals, arrests and citations during the above years. 
2. The number of arrests of students on CPS property from July 1, 2021 to current broken down by CPS property name and address. Please break this data down by age of arrestee. RESPONSE : A portion of the information you seek can be found online. Please visit the CPS data website which includes police notification information: https://www.cps.edu/about/district-data/metrics/ . Scroll to the bottom of the page and download the spreadsheets beside the “Suspensions and Expulsions” header. 
Be advised that you may wish to submit a FOIA request to the Chicago Police Department (CPD) for “arrests of students” information at the following website: https://home.chicagopolice.org/inside-cpd/freedom-of-information-act-foia/ . 
Pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/8.5: Records maintained online. (a) Notwithstanding any provision of this Act, to the contrary, a public body is not required to copy a public record that is published on the public body’s website. The public body shall notify the requester that the public record is available online and direct the requester to the website where the record can be reasonably accessed. 
As to the remainder of your request, be advised that the CPS FOIA office has determined that it does not properly identify a document(s) for search and would require a CPS FOIA Officer to conduct research and create a new record. To search for the information you seek in the manner requested, a FOIA Officer would need to go to various departments, research, create a list of possible responsive records, and answer questions, which is not required pursuant to the FOIA. 
Under the Illinois FOIA law, a request to inspect or copy a record must reasonably identify a public record, as opposed to general data, information or statistics to be gleaned from documents which have not otherwise been created by a public body. Accordingly, FOIA applies to the provision of existing public records; a public body is not required to answer questions or generate new records in response to a FOIA request. 
Further, section 1 of FOIA states in part: “This Act is not intended to create an obligation on the part of any public body to maintain or prepare any public record which was not maintained or prepared by such public body at the time when this Act becomes effective, except as otherwise required by applicable local, State or federal law.” In accordance with Section 1 of the Illinois FOIA, the District is not required to conduct research to answer your questions or prepare researched records on your behalf in response to your request. In the case of a denial, pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) you may file a Request for Review with the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at: Public Access Counselor; Office of the Attorney General; 500 South 2nd Street; Springfield, IL 62706.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court; 5 ILCS 140/11. Thank you for your request. Sincerely, Ana Diaz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

title: City of Cortez Employee and Board Member Turnover Rate

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent with the following text strings anywhere in the body or subject line, partial or complete:

1 - resignation
2 - resign

Include any correspondence from within City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc'd: or any other emails.

Please aggregate by the five categories and provide me the following information for all emails sent or cc'd into the City's emails from Jan. 1 2002 to the present to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts to include:

1. From address
2. To address
3. bcc addresses
4. cc addresses
5. Time
6. Date
7. Subject


Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. This is lessen the burden as expressed by your city attorney, and to expedite the request. 

I am more than happy to provide documentation or tips for extracting this information from your mail server if needed. Google's Vault tooling should make this request straightforward to complete. E-mail metadata is trivially exportable from the IT infrastructure of any modern e-mail archiving or data retention system - such as Microsoft Outlook 365, Google, Datacove, etc. - and should be deliverable in a .CSV, .XLS, or other machine readable format. PDF is not preferred, and seems to have issues displaying the entire fields.

Please note that I am not requesting the contents of each email. E-mail metadata does not include the contents of the specified e-mails, thus do not need individual review for redaction.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. If possible, I would request a waiver of all fees for searching or copying these records in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding.

1. When filing this, please note which documents have already been paid for by another FOIA request, and I request that if those documents have already been screened, that they not be duplicated in cost.
2. Since this is an electronic request, the print version should not be provided, but for purposes of cost estimation, please take into consideration that Cortez population is underprivileged, and extend the courtesy of pricing accordingly.
2a. The economic information for this judgment comes from the submission done by myself of Kauffman Indicators of Entrepreneurship for Montezuma County in comparison to many surrounding counties in Utah, New Mexico, and Colorado. As seen in page 8 of the enclosed and publicly presented documents August 22, 2023, Montezuma County has compensation ranking at 39.27% within the Kaufmann Entrepreneurial Jobs Indicators, meaning that the policy taken by Cortez brings it into direct conflict with the interests of the people they impact should they price these or other electronic documents at a punitive rate.
2b. Because these documents are of the public interest, and the population is demonstrably disadvantaged, the policies of Cortez which require hundreds or thousands of dollars to achieve transparency could be construed poorly in civil proceedings, meaning that legal fees could ensue which would further penalize City of Cortez budgets. This is not my intent, therefore I state it up front that the best course of action would be to ensure that FOIA costs are not borne as specified.
3. Staff time to review these documents should reflect the actual costs, not the maximum costs allowed by CORA law, please recalculate these costs taking into consideration both the public interest as well as eliminating from your cost estimate any documents previously screened by staff.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely, 

Charles Jeter
---------

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Charles Jeter

communications.subject: Jeter 22 - Records Request - Muckrock #163449-66558027
communications.communication:
Mr. Jeter, in response to the request for records pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act that the City received from you and that is listed below, the City responds as follows:

I.                                              Request:

I am writing to request metadata relating to emails sent with the following text strings anywhere in the body or subject line, partial or complete:

1 – resignation
2 – resign
Include any correspondence from within the City of Cortez where the email address which is inbound or outbound or cc’d: or any other emails.

Please aggregate by the five categories and provide me the following information for all emails sent or cc’d into the City’s emails from Jan. 1 2002 to the present to/from/cc/bcc the above-listed accounts to include:


  1.  From address
  2.  To address
  3.  Bcc addresses
  4.  cc addresses
  5.  Time
  6.  Date
  7.  Subject



II.                                           Response:

The City processed this request pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, C.R.S. 24-72-200.1, et seq. (CORA).  Pursuant to CORA, there is no charge for the first hour of time spent by the City retrieving and reviewing records, and all time thereafter is charged at $33.58 per hour.  This response required less than one hour of staff time, so there is no charge.  Attached is a record containing the metadata that is responsive to your request.





Linda L. Smith
City Clerk
City of Cortez
www.cortezco.gov

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1)  All email communications (including email attachments, and complete email chains) between Secretary of State Jay Ashcroft (or anyone communicating on his behalf, including office staff) and Hans von Spakovsky (hans.vonspakovsky@heritage.org) sent or received between January 1, 2024 and the date this request is processed. 

2) Any email communications, including full email chains and attachments, sent or received by Secretary of State Jay Ashcroft (or anyone communicating on his behalf, including office staff) between January 1, 2024 and the date this request is processed with the following keywords: "Hans von Spakovsky," "von Spakovsky," and/or "Spakovsky."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alice Herman

communications.communication:
We are in receipt of your request.  Because your request involves searching email, your request has been forwarded to out IT Department.  We expect that we can have a response to your request by next Thursday, June 27, 2024.  If we run into any difficulties we will advise.

Frank Jung
General Counsel/Records Custodian

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Schaap refs
communications.communication:
Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 106 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 785 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,695 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,088 days for processing.

Respectfully,


Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
170 Marcel Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
F: (540) 868-4391
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1471273-000
communications.communication: You know full well you are not permitted to charge duplication fees since you've taken more than the legally permitted amount of time to process the request, I am a member of the news media (and recognized as such) and the records do not exceed 5,000 pages. Your demand for fees (yet again) is not only improper but illegal, and I request that you proceed with processing the request as demanded by law.

communications.subject: 2024-00182-F
communications.communication:
Good Morning,

I have uploaded our final response to your FOIA request to the DOD SAFE Website - (https://safe.apps.mil <https://safe.apps.mil> ).

DOD SAFE for 2024-00182-F


Please Note:

Upon receipt of the DOD SAFE e-mail, you will have 7 days to retrieve the drop-off; after that the link will expire.
If you are unable to download the documents please inform us AS SOON AS POSSIBLE, so we can work with you to obtain the documents.

How to retrieve your documents:
You will receive a separate email from the DOD SAFE website; the email comes from the following email address: NoReplyTo@mail.mil <mailto:NoReplyTo@mail.mil> Please check your Spam or Junk mail folder if you do not see their email in your e-mail inbox.

The email sent by the DOD SAFE Website will provide you with a website address link so you can access the website.

The email sent by the DOD SAFE Website will provide you with a Claim ID that you will need to enter to access the website.

You must enter this Claim ID before using our passphrase.

Once you are in the website, you can use the below passphrase - which will allow you to download your documents.

THE PASSPHRASE TO OPEN YOUR DOCUMENTS IS:  AFOSIfoia00182

AFOSI (all UPPER case) foia (all lower case) 00182 (CASE NUMBER)

NO SPACES IN BETWEEN

PASSPHRASE:  AFOSIfoia00182

Thank you.

FOIA
HQ/FSS/MSII
27130 Telegraph Rd.
Quantico, VA 22134
Comm: 571-305-8044; DSN: 240-8044
Fax: 571-305-8229
afosi_hq_foia_requests@us.af.mil <mailto:afosi_hq_foia_requests@us.af.mil>

title: Threats to Dean Preston by journalist

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Threats to Dean Preston by journalist
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the dates between June. 1, 2020 and June 14,  2024:

ALL CORRESPONDENCE OF ANY KIND, written or electronic, including all texts, emails, letters, Signal, BlueSky, Facebook, Meta, Twitter, direct messages, phone calls, etc., between District 5 supervisor Dean Preston and the following:

City attorney’s Office

District Attorney’s Office

San Francisco Police Department

 San Francisco Police Department Chief William Scott

Current or former staff or members of the Board of Supervisors, including but not limited to:

Hillary Ronen 

Shamann Walton

Aaron Peskin 

Matt Haney

Any of these members of the media or any other media companies:

Joe Fitzerald Rodriguez, Fitz, Joe Fitz, Joe Fitz Rodriguez

Joe Eskenazi  and/or Mission Local

Tim Redmond and/or 48 Hills

Bob Egelko

San Francisco Chronicle

Society for Professional Journalists Northern California chapter 

Any member of the Goosby family including but not limited to Jenckyn Goosby (his wife) and his children

THAT MENTION the following names and/or terms: 

Susan Dyer Reynolds

Journalist 

Marina Times

Security 

911

Police Report

Newspaper 

Twitter

Threats

Threats to family

The Purge

Purge Movie(s)

Horror in the Haight

Preston’s Purge (in any format, including Preston Purge, #PrestonsPurge)

Any and all of the following:

All 911 calls made by Preston or members of his family regarding threats made to Preston or his family by Susan Dyer Reynolds.

All police reports filed by Preston or members of his family regarding threats made to Preston or his family by Susan Dyer Reynolds.

Any requests for security (measures, personnel, detail) — either private or through the City of San Francisco — made by Preston or members of his family regarding threats made to Preston or his family by Susan Dyer Reynolds.

Any requests to any security company for adding security to their home(s) made by Preston or members of his family regarding threats made to Preston or his family by Susan Dyer Reynolds.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Belle Reve

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Traffic Stop Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A tabular data file containing all information collected in accordance with Texas Crim. Pro. Code § 2.132-4 including but not limited to: date of stop, time of stop, race of driver, gender of driver, age of driver, if search occurred, if contraband was found, anonymized officer ID, and stop location for all available years.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexander Love

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of April 18, 2024, Reference # P076852-041824 Dear Alexander Love, In response to your above-referenced request, which was received by the City of Houston [ASSIGNED_DEPART] on April 18, 2024, the custodian of records has determined that complying with your request will result in the imposition of a charge that exceeds $40. Therefore, we are providing you with this cost estimate as required by section 552.2615 of the Texas Government Code. The itemized list of charges are: [2.75 hours ($15.00 per hour) + 20% Overhead] Labor Charge: $49.50 
Total Charge: $49.50 This not a request to pay at this time. We are simply informing you of cost. The request should be complete by 5 pm on May 29, 2024. There is a less expensive way for you to obtain this information.  You may narrow or clarify your request.  You may view the information in person at our offices.  These charges may be reduced if you narrow or clarify the scope of your request. 
Please note that this request will be considered automatically withdrawn if you do not respond in writing within ten business days of the date of this letter that you either: 1) accept the charges and agree to pay them, 2) modify your request in response to the cost estimate provided herein, or 3) have sent, or are sending, a complaint regarding the charges to the Texas Attorney General. You may respond to this statement by mail or in person at 1200 Travis Street, at fax number, 713-308-9150, or by responding to this email.  You may also go to your records center to review your request and the invoice of charges. 
You may send your check payable to the City of Houston to my attention at 1200 Travis Street, and referencing P076852-041824 or you may use the payment portal. If you wish to pick up your documents, please contact me at the phone number below to arrange a mutually acceptable date and time. When picking up your documents, you will need to bring correct change or a check for the total amount referenced in the itemized list of charges minus the postage. 
If you have any questions regarding this matter, please contact Kimberly Coyle at 713-308-9183. 
Sincerely, 
Kimberly Coyle 
Administrative Supervisor 
Houston Police Department (HPD)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: University of Georgia 4/29 Protests (Office of the Governor of Georgia)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications, including SMS text messages, microsoft teams messages, slack messages, groupme messages, e-mails, g-chat messages, signal messages, telegram messages, WhatsApp messages, Facebook messenger messages,  sent or received by the following individuals on from April 1, 2024, to the current date, which concerns or mentions "Israel", "Palestine", "anti-semitism", "antisemitism", "anti-semitic", "antisemitic", or "IHRA,” Protest," "Columbia," "Palestine," "Gaza," "Israel," "Hamas," "Agitators."

a. Jere Morehead, President
b. S. Jack Hu, Senior Vice President for Academic Affairs and Provost
c. Michelle G. Cook, Vice President for Student Affairs
d. P. Daniel Silk, Associate Vice President for Public Safety
e.  Jeff Clark, Chief of UGA Police
f. Rebecca Scarboro, Director for the Office of Student Conduct
h. Brett Malone, Associate Dean of Students

2. Any communications (including SMS text messages, microsoft teams messages, slack messages, groupme messages, e-mails, g-chat messages, signal messages, telegram messages, WhatsApp messages, Facebook messenger messages) to or from Jere Morehead, any person employed by the Office of the President, or any person employed by the State of Georgia Government, on the one hand, and any elected official (including Gov. Brian Kemp, Lt. Gov. Burt Jones, any member of the Georgia legislature, or any Member of Congress) or any member of the staff (such as aides, secretaries, or assistants) of an elected official, on the other hand, between April 1, 2024 to Current date, inclusive.

3. Any communications (including SMS text messages, microsoft teams messages, slack messages, groupme messages, e-mails, g-chat messages, signal messages, telegram messages, WhatsApp messages, Facebook messenger messages) to or from Jere Morehead, any person employed by the Office of the President, or any person employed by the State of Georgia Government, on the one hand, and any elected official (including Gov. Brian Kemp, Lt. Gov. Burt Jones, any member of the Georgia legislature, or any Member of Congress) or any member of the staff (such as aides, secretaries, or assistants) of an elected official, on the other hand, between April 1, 2024 to Current date, inclusive. which concerns or mentions "Israel", "Palestine", "anti-semitism", "antisemitism", "anti-semitic", "antisemitic", or "IHRA,” Protest," "Columbia," "Palestine," "Gaza," "Israel," "Hamas," "Agitators."

4.


Please also note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: RE: Georgia Open Records Act Request: University of Georgia 4/29 Protests (Office of the Governor of Georgia)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Georgia Open Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on May 14, 2024. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Re: Georgia Open Records Act Request: University of Georgia 4/29 Protests (Office of the Governor of Georgia)
communications.communication:
Josh -

We have received your open records request. It appears that this request may have been intended for President Morehead's office. We are not the records custodian for that office, and will only have responsive records to the extent that such records were sent to or from the Office of the Governor.

Nevertheless, to the extent we have responsive records, we will endeavor to respond to your request. I have broken out our responses/requests for clarification below, corresponding to the separate items in your request:


  1.
We do not have records responsive to this request.

  2.
Please clarify the scope of this request. First, there are no search terms or keywords identified for this request. Second, the request includes "communications...to or from...any person employed by the State of Georgia Government, on the one hand, and any elected official...or any member of the staff of an elected official, on the other hand." Interpreted literally and applied to the Office of the Governor, this would essentially cover every email sent to or from our office to any state employee, regardless of subject or keywords. This is likely to return thousands of documents and incur significant costs. Please confirm whether this is the intended scope of your request.

  3.
Please clarify the scope of this request. Similar to part (2), this request includes "communications...to or from...any person employed by the State of Georgia Government, on the one hand, and any elected official...or any member of the staff of an elected official, on the other hand." With the inclusion of the specified keywords, there are likely to be somewhat fewer responsive documents, but I am not sure whether this is the intended scope.

     *

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request: PUCT - PIA Q1 2024
communications.communication:
*** PUC Open Records Auto-Response. Please do not reply to this e-mail. ***
Thank you for submitting your open records request under the Public Information Act (PIA) to the Public Utility Commission of Texas (PUC). Your request has been forwarded to the PUC’s Public Information Coordinator. The Public Information Coordinator will address PIA requests in the order they are received, but in all cases within the time prescribed by law.
Time To Respond
We will promptly respond to your request by providing the requested information, informing you there is no responsive information, or notifying you all or a portion of the requested information falls under an exception to public disclosure and requires a ruling from the Office of the Attorney General (OAG). If the requested information does not fall under an exception to public disclosure but will take longer than 10 business days to produce, we will notify you of the date and time the information will be provided.
Request for Clarification
You can help us respond more quickly to your request by ensuring that your request is clear, specific, and requests only the information you wish to receive. We do our best to relate requests to the information we have and do not require records to be requested by their specific names, but if you know the specific name of the record you are requesting, it will help us respond more efficiently.
If your request is vague or overly broad, we may, in compliance with Texas Government Code § 552.222, request clarification in order to ensure we understand what information you are requesting.  Also, please keep in mind that we are not required under the PIA to create new information, do legal research, or answer questions.  See Open Records Decision Nos. 555 and 563 at https://www.texasattorneygeneral.gov/open-government/open-records-decisions.
Withholding Information
Although the PIA makes most government information available to the public, some exceptions exist. If we believe an exception applies, we will notify you that the information cannot be released and request a ruling from the OAG.
Costs
You may be charged for costs associated with responding to your request.  Personnel time is charged at $15 per hour, plus 20% of the personnel charge for overhead. There is also a charge of $0.10 per page, plus personnel time, if the request exceeds fifty pages, plus postage. These rates are set by the OAG.  You can find more information regarding costs associated with PIA requests here: https://texreg.sos.state.tx.us/public/readtac$ext.ViewTAC?tac_view=4&ti=1&pt=3&ch=70&rl=Y.
For more information regarding access to public information held by the PUC, please visit our website at https://www.puc.texas.gov/agency/about/contact/PIA.aspx.

You may also find more detailed information regarding the PIA in Texas Government Code Chapter 552 or on the OAG’s website at https://www.texasattorneygeneral.gov/open-government/members-public.

Thank you for getting back to me for clarification. My answers to your questions are:

1. I'm seeking all closed requests, not just ones where an OAG ruling was sought.
2. I would like to know the name and institutional affiliation of the requestor, but I don't need their contact information. communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request 2024-05-005
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Manning,

Thank you for your response to the PUC’s clarification request.

As we prepare to gather the information responsive to your request, we would like to inform you that one requestor has asked that their personal information remain confidential. If you are interested in this information, we would need to request a ruling from the Office of the Attorney General so the requestor may submit their arguments as to why their information should be withheld.

You have indicated the only personal information you are interested in is the requestors’ names and institutional affiliation. Because of this, we will need to request a ruling on whether we must redact this one requestor’s remaining personal information (i.e., their name). However, if you are not interested in the name nor personal information of this one requestor, we can redact their name and provide you with the released information. Please note this requestor has no institutional affiliation listed in their request.

Please specify whether you are interested in the name of this one requestor.

You may send your response by email, mail, or in person to our office.

Public Utility Commission of Texas

1701 N. Congress Avenue, 7th Floor
P.O. Box 13326
Austin, Texas 78701

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: COTA Free Fares Report
communications.communication:
Hi Nicole,

I thought that that query was both specific and narrowly-tailored. The request does not duplicate a major category of records, and does not seek "all records containing particular words" or "every report filed with the public office for a particular time period". My request asked for only specific reports during a specific time span, and only for records that were pertaining to a specific topic.

Since you disagreed as to the narrowness of that request, allow me to modify the request to be even more specific and provide additional information to help you ascertain which records are responsive:

A copy of any PDF, Word Document, InDesign Document, and/or email, received by COTA's Office of the President, which was originally sent by the Ice Miller law firm or its affiliate Whiteboard, received in the years 2020 or 2021, containing or about a particular report, hereinafter referred to as "the report". The report is the final report in a study which was commissioned by COTA, which explored various ways to fund the portion of COTA's budget which is currently sourced from passenger fares, in the event that COTA decided to make passenger fares free. The report was commissioned about three years ago (2018-2020) and completed about a year later (2020-2021). The study and report were paid for in part using COTA funds. The report may be referred to as "the Ice Miller report" in casual usage. I am interested in the final report document, in whatever format it was provided in.

Please let me know whether you require additional detail to identify this report.

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: COTA Free Fares Report
communications.communication:
Hi Nicole,

I disagree with your characterization of my request as "ambiguous and overly broad" as follows:

1. "all records containing particular words" - This request is for a specific report with an identified subject matter, not "all records" containing particular words.  
2. "duplication for all records having to do with a particular topic" - This request is for a specific report pertaining to a particular topic, not all records pertaining to that topic.  
3. "all records of a particular type" - This request is for a specific report in whatever format it may be in, not all records of a particular type or format.  
4. "all emails sent or received by a particular email address with no subject matter or time limitation" - This request is for a specific report. In the event that that report may have been transmitted by email, the email is identified with subject matter and time limitations.  
5. "all documents which document any and all instances of a particular topic" - This request is for a specific report, with certain identifying characteristics noted in the request. This is not a request for all documents which discuss this report's topic.  
6. "discovery-style requests that seek all records relating to or reflecting certain types of information" - This request is limited by date range, the name of the report's author, the report's subject matter, and the type of document containing the report. This is a request for a specific report. It is not a discovery-style request.   

Below, I have rephrased my request in order to make it clearer which records I am requesting. I have also included additional information about the requested record, which further narrows the scope of the request.

I request a copy of a report in COTA's possession. The report has all of the following characteristics:

1. Prepared by Ice Miller or its affiliate Whiteboard
2. Originally sent by the Ice Miller law firm or its affiliate Whiteboard
3. Received by COTA in December 2022 or in January 2021
4. Titled "Fare-Free Transit Analysis" or with similar words
5. With a subject matter of free public transportation or fare-free transit
6. Commissioned by COTA, and paid for in some part using COTA funds

The following details are provided to help you in your search, but the requested document may not meet all or any of these characteristics:

1. The report may have been attached to an email from Michael.Coleman@icemiller.com or from an @icemiller.com email address
2. The email or report may be dated December 4, 2020, or later
3. The email or report may mention Robert Miller, a past COTA Board member
4. The report may have been included in an email sent to Joanna Pinkerton, to PinkertonJM@cota.com, to another COTA employee in the COTA Office of the President at that time, to Terry Foegler, and/or to Sophia Mohr

In the event that multiple versions of the report are discovered, I request the final version of the report. In the event that the report is available in multiple formats, I request the digital version of the PDF, Word Document, or other original document(s) sent to COTA. In the event that the report is split across multiple files or documents (such as a cover letter, a slide deck, and appendices), I request those documents which are necessary to compile the complete report. In the event that the report was submitted by electronic mail to COTA, I also request a copy of the email that was used to send the files comprising the report, in addition to the report files themselves.

If this information is still insufficient to identify the responsive records, then pursuant to ORC 149.43(B)(2) I request a copy of COTA's document retention schedule, and information on the manner in which records are retained by COTA and its Office of the President and accessed in the ordinary course of the office's duties.

Thanks,

Benjamin Keith

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: COTA Free Fares Report
communications.communication:
Hi Nicole,

Thank you for these records, but I don't think the document you sent over is all responsive records. 

Several pages contain superscript annotations of the sort normally used to indicate a reference, but these references are not explained in the provided document. I expect that the complete set of responsive documents includes an appendix or attachment containing the references for these annotations. Please check again to make sure that you have located all responsive documents.

The report's cover letter opens with the preface, "Via Electronic Mail". I requested "a copy of the email that was used to send the files comprising the report, in addition to the report files themselves." Since you have successfully located the report, which was sent by email, you must have identified and located the email that contained the report. Please send a copy of that email.

Thanks again,
Ben Keith

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: COTA Free Fares Report
communications.communication:
All the records responsive to your request have been forwarded.
Regards

Nicole M. Weathers
Paralegal/ Public Records Officer

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: COTA Free Fares Report
communications.communication:
Hi Nicole,

Some records responsive to this request have not been forwarded.

COTA's records retention schedule for email is 7 years, across the entire agency. I refer you to the document "RC2-INFORMATION-TECHNOLOGY-1.2.pdf" which was returned in another public records request, and which I have attached to this email. On page 2, the records retention schedule says that COTA retains "Electronic Mail (Authority wide)" for 7 years in a digital format.

I requested "a copy of the email that was used to send the files comprising the report, in addition to the report files themselves." This email would have been sent in December 2020. December 2020 is 2 years and 1 month ago. Two years is less than 7 years. The responsive email should be retained under COTA's document retention policy.

Since you have successfully located the report, which was sent by email, you must have identified and located the email that contained the report. Send me a copy of that email.

Thanks,
Ben Keith

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: GoGoGadgetMachineLab
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records associated with coordination or interaction regarding -
The Declassification Engine, The History Lab
Matthew Connelly, Columbia University
Address: 403 Fayerweather Hall
Phone: (212) 854-4563
Contact: mjc96@columbia.edu

Please advise of "unusual circumstances" regarding changes to the status of this request.

NOTE: I request clarification and continuation of interest queries via this same channel of communication. Delivering physical mail to long deprecated and no longer used addresses does not fulfill the legal obligations of United States FOI code 5 U.S.C. § 552.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Martin Peck

communications.subject: USSOCOM FOIA 2024-343 - Acknowledgement and Final Response
communications.communication:
Hello Mr. Peck,

 

The U.S. Special Operations Command (USSOCOM) received your Freedom of
Information Act (FOIA) request for documents specifically outlined in your
request and have assigned it control number USSOCOM FOIA 2024-343. Please
refer to this number should you have any questions concerning your request.


We have placed you in the News Media category for fee purposes, which means
you are obligated to pay all duplication costs after the first 100 pages.
In addition, a fee agreement is the amount you would give consent to pay
associated with the processing of a request for information.  In the future,
along with your request for information, it will be necessary for you to
submit a fee agreement stating the costs you are willing to incur before
your request can continue to be processed. Upon receipt of your fee
agreement, your request would then be processed in accordance with
procedural requirements promulgated in Department of Defense (DoD)
Regulation 5400.07, which is available on the internet at
<https://open.defense.gov/Portals/23/Documents/FOIA/FOIA_Resources/DoDM%2054
00.07.pdf?ver=2017-03-15-135646-847>
https://open.defense.gov/Portals/23/Documents/FOIA/FOIA_Resources/DoDM%20540
0.07.pdf?ver=2017-03-15-135646-847.  If we believe processing fees would
exceed your cost agreement, we would advise.  In this case, though, no fees
were assessed.

The actual processing time was dependent upon its complexity, whether it
involved sensitive records, voluminous records, extensive searches,
consultation among DoD components or other agencies, and our administrative
workload. The USSOCOM FOIA Office has a substantial number of pending FOIA
cases and, therefore, we process requests in a multi-track processing system
based on the date of receipt and the amount of work and time involved in
processing each request.  

 

Due to size constraints when emailing final response documents to FOIA
requesters, your FOIA

request, USSOCOM's final response letter, and all responsive information in
redacted format, if any,

is being sent to you electronically via DoD SAFE. You will receive a
separate email containing an

individual username and password. Once the email is received, click on the
link provided and you will

be directed to DoD SAFE. You will then be prompted to enter the provided
username and password.

Once entered, you will see the documents being sent to you along with
instructions on how to

download them.

 

USSOCOM FOIA 2024-343 is closed with no further action from this office.

 

Regards,

 

Connie

 

Connie H. Rupp

USSOCOM Acquisition FOIA/FOIA/PA/CL Officer

U.S. Special Operations Command

Phone:  (813) 826-4030

DSN:       299-4030

SVOIP:   299-5990

NIPR:  <mailto:connie.rupp@socom.mil> connie.rupp@socom.mil

SIPR:  <mailto:connie.rupp@socom.smil.mil> connie.rupp@socom.smil.mil

JWICS:   (Upon request)

Best regards,
- Martin Peck

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Kevin P. Mulcahy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Any and all files on CIA officer Kevin P. Mulcahy who died in 1982.

http://www.nytimes.com/1982/11/01/us/for-kevin-a-way-of-life-and-death.html
http://www.nytimes.com/1982/11/21/us/ex-cia-man-s-death-laid-to-natural-causes.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Joseph Lloyd

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Prison Transfer Policy and Communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents pertaining to DOCCS policy or documentation about inter-prison transfers of incarcerated people (see below for a note about what is meant by “inter-prison transfers,” in case the term is unclear or does not align with DOCCS terminology). Specifically, I am requesting: 

1) All policies, procedures, memorandums of understanding, intergovernmental agreements, any other sort of agreement, and all related directive materials regarding the transfer of incarcerated persons between different facilities within New York state. 

2) From 1/1/2020 through 12/31/2021 specifically: all documents, papers, letters, email correspondence, memoranda, training materials, presentations, directives, guidance, press releases, or other communications (both internal and external) about transfers and COVID-19. This includes – but is not limited to – any memos, emails, or directives issued/produced in 2020 or 2021 that discuss transfer procedures and mention COVID-19, health precautions, and/or respiratory illness. It also includes (but is not limited to) any memos, emails, or directives issued/produced in 2020 or 2021 that discuss changes to the frequency of transfers in response to the virus (e.g., halting transfers, minimizing transfers, transferring at-risk incarcerated people, etc.). 

3) Any contracts or agreements regarding inter-prison transfers, including but not limited to a contract with a private transfer company, vehicle purchasing or leasing, and so on.

NOTE ON DEFINITION: By inter-prison transfer, I am referring to any non-temporary change in an incarcerated person’s housing facility. In other words, any movement of an incarcerated person that would change their “Housing/Releasing Facility,” as recorded in DOCCS’s “Incarcerated Lookup” database. This would include – but is not limited to – movements resulting from disciplinary proceedings (i.e., raised security level or other safety risks), movements to lower security facilities, transfers resulting from incarcerated person-initiated transfer requests, transfers preceding facility closure, and/or transfers to accommodate medical, program, or other needs. If the records provided refer to movements more broadly than this definition of transfers, that is acceptable and please send them. However, if there are records that refer ONLY to types of movements that would not include inter-prison transfers as defined here, they fall outside of this request. If there is any question about this, please feel free to reach out and I am happy to clarify.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Iolanthe Brooks

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: Demonstration drone footage
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Jersey Open Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any footage (video or photo) taken by the Hackensack Police Department's drone at the March 10, 2024 demonstration in Teaneck.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti
